hackathon-description-text: The Neura SDK allows you to tune your product's performance to each individual user depending on their activites and context. With your user's permission, your app gets better insights to help you create more useful features, ultimately creating happier, more loyal users.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Frank M. Freimann Professor Computer Science and Engineering, University of Notre Dame

hackathon-eligibility: Teams may consist of 1-6 members. You should register first and can always add or remove team members later on.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $4000 in cash and a $600 Oculus Rift (Includes: headset, sensor, remote, cables, Xbox One controller, and Lucky's Tale).
Amazon Echo will be given to the participant or team with the most votes on their project

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Bonus Award Category: Context + Emotional Intelligence!

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does your product solve a real problem or can it bring a lot of joy to people?
How simple is your product to use? How fast can the user learn to use it?
We love seeing Neura's SDK integrated to solve problems in creative ways!
This is totally not necessary, but props if you've integrated Neura's SDK on both Android and iOS versions of your app.
Does your app do what you say it does?

hackathon-description-header: Increase your app's user engagement & retention with Neura's SDK
